availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
The Commonwealth of Kentucky,
To the Marshal of the City of Lexington -- Greeting

YOU ARE HEREBY COMMANDED TO SUMMON W. A. Lindsay to appear before the Lexington City Court, on the 23rd day of Feby 1865, to answer to the City of Lexington, why he should not be fined for Keeping open his tavern Saloon on Sunday on the 5th of Feby 1865, within the limits of the City of Lexington, contrary to the Ordinances of the City of Lexington in such cases made and provided, and against the peace and dignity of the City, and then make return how you have executed this warrant.

WITNESS: The Clerk of our said Court at Lexington, this 8 day of Feby 1865.
a copy att. Geo D. Letcher C. L. C. C.
You are also commanded to summon Jas Jeffries, Saml Downing, Harvey Graves, Jas Platt, Van. Worsham, Lee Palhatt, F. Lyons, Geo Stoll Jr. Jas. Lewis.
a copy att. Geo K. Letcher C. L. C. C.

Executed March 9th 1865
Chas H. Wickliffe
Dep. M C L.
a copy att Geo K. Letcher
C L. C C

City of Lexington
vs } copy of Warrant
W. A. Lindsay
